title: Riot, you gave Tahm Kench and Bard WAY too much trolling capability.
body:
I never thought it was an issue, sure when they first came out, it had crossed my mind but I eventually thought that I'd never come across one. But holy crap, I just witnessed it and it was annoying. Jungle Tahm and Support Bard, they were a duo, no proof but they took the same summoners were always together and all their trolling was in sync. They both took Ghost+Smite and when I asked them, they replied with, "i'm a smurf trust me I'll carry". Bard didn't even enter bot lane and our AD Carry was forced to 1v2 all lane phase. Bard and Tahm went on an invade and gave first blood. Bard was soloing jungle camps and getting executed in the early game. They weren't the usual "I'm just gonna take Clairvoyance and Clarity and run into the enemy team". They were using their abilities specifically to troll, and in some ways, were playing the game as normally as it's meant to be played every other time.

For example, Bard would ult me when I was getting chased by 3 enemies so they could catch up. Bard would ult 3 people who were about to get caught in the middle of Panth ult. I was running to lane to help out in a fight, I even took homeguards, I was watching the fight and when I realised I wasn't going anywhere, I realised that Tahm ate me and ran back to lane and just spit me back out into fountain and was laugh emoting the whole time. There were also a few instances where Tahm ate me and spat me out into the enemy team.

Worst thing was, if only ONE of them was trolling and we had a decent and serious 4th member, we could've easily won that 4v5. Their team wasn't very good apart from the Fizz, but that could also be just because he was fed, I don't know.

But like, this kind of stuff should've been accounted for when Riot created these two champs, like, there lots of kids who play this game and trolls are prominent in this game, they didn't even anticipate it?

replies.body: I'm sure they realised while designing these champs that there would be trolls, but their ultimate decision was that the existence of players like that shouldn't limit creative and innovative champion design. I agree with Riot on this one.
Okay, that's an interesting way to put it and I agree. I just wish they did SOMETHING to put a cap on their trolling capabilities

Tbh people are going to troll either way, and if I'm going to be trolled either way, id rather have bard ult me or get a free ride in tahm's belly than have someone just running into the enemy team every time they spawn. if you're gunna troll and make us lose, at least do it in interesting ways.
That's an interesting take, but any encouragement for trolling is bad in my opinion and these two champs are walking encouragements for trolls.

You're taking this the wrong way 

those two champs have the capability to influence their allies in a way other than shielding or buffing 
this kinda thing is rare in champions in league "at least to allied champions"

I'm glad riot is doing these types of things because i think the last time it's been done is threshes lantern 
and when that came out every one was talking about how it would change the game and it did 

bard ult ? it's like a anti wombo / tower protection tool that is so legit in pro games
tom makes it so any hero in the game has the ability to travel great distances of the map 

me and a friend of mine used it to backdoor towers and it worked and that's hardly even trying

I get that, I LOVE things similar to Dark Passage. The difference with Thresh's lantern and Bard's Ult or Tahm's Devour is that the other involved player has a choice. You can click either click the lantern, or don't click the lantern, your call. You can't choose whether you get Bard ulted or Tahm Devoured or not. If your ally wants manipulate your champion's state in a negative way, they're gonna do it, because they can and you don't have a single say in it.
